What should I do if I have health problems during my stay in Spain?  If during your stay in Spain you develop symptoms of acute respiratory infection (fever, cough or difficulty in breathing) or other symptoms compatible with COVID-19 such as reduced sense of smell and taste, chills, sore throat, muscle aches, headache, general weakness, diarrhea or vomiting, you must commit to:    Self-isolating: staying at home or place of accommodation and self-isolating in a room. Preferably in a room for individual use, which is well ventilated and with an individual bathroom. If this is not possible, the safety distance of 1.5 metres should be guaranteed and a surgical mask should be worn when in contact with other people living with the patient. Be very careful with hygiene.  Contact the health service: contact the competent health authorities of the Autonomous Communities by telephone. If you feeling that the illness is serious, you have shortness of breath or chest pain, call 112.  What should I do if I had had close contact with a diagnosed case of COVID-19 during my stay in Spain?  If you have had close contact with a COVID-19 case and you are not vaccinated with a complete vaccination regimen, you should quarantine: if you have had close contact with a patient with COVID-19 or someone suspected of having it without adequate protective measures, from 48 hours before the onset of symptoms, you should quarantine for 7 days staying in your home or place of accommodation, preferably in a room on your own. During the following 10 days after the last contact, protection measures should be stepped up (use of masks, limiting the number of social contacts, etc).    For more information you can consult the website of the Ministry of Health of the Government of Spain, dedicated to the health emergency due to COVID-19, in different languages, on this link.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220315234253/https://www.spth.gob.es/faq?tab=2  https://web.archive.org/web/20220518025808/https://www.spth.gob.es/faq?tab=2

These requirements apply to those born in or before 2006. They however do not apply to citizens of Finland, those with permanent residence in Finland, or persons traveling for essential reasons. Those who do not meet the requirement are required to have a mandatory covid test. Those who are not fully vaccinated will only be allowed to enter Finland if they provide evidence of an essential or compassionate reason for entry. This does not include tourism.
